Created attachment 30875
Fix for this ticket

Compilation of APR 2.0.0 trunk fails in CYGWIN.
It happens that configure script finds windows.h and other include files for native coding, but they should not be used: they must be included only in a native environment like MSVC, MINGW or CYGWIN with gcc-3 and -no-cygwin (deprecated!), so only when WIN32 macro is defined.

Attached patch fixes this bug.

Sincerely,

Carlo Bramini.
creator: carlo.bramix@libero.it

text:
If you are planning to build the latest APR on CYGWIN (1.5.x. or 1.7.x does not matter, I tried myself right now), I just wanted to write that probably you won't be able to do that without tricks: perhaps you will be forced to feed options like --without-sqlite3, --without-odbc, etc, otherwise the build of the modules will fail because their dependency to libapr (see bug #54291).
For the compatibility with CYGWIN, I also recommend the fixes inside bug #51016 and bug #55587.

Sincerely,

Carlo Bramini.
